raw_text:
Agassi fear for Melbourne
 
 Andre Agassi's involvement in the Australian Open was put in doubt after he pulled out of the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury.
 
 Agassi was serving at 5-6 down in the first set to fellow American Andy Roddick when he decided to bring a premature end to the match. "My hip was cramping and I just could not continue," said the 34-year-old. Agassi, who has won the Australian Open four times, will have an MRI scan to discover the extent of the damage. He said the problem was not the same as the hip injury which forced him to miss Wimbledon last year.
 
 "The good news is that it didn't just tear, it was tightening up and that can be your body protecting itself, which is hopefully more of the issue," he added. "That wasn't comfortable out there at all, what I was feeling. "I have to wait and see what I'm dealing with - it's a pretty scary feeling out there when something doesn't feel right and is getting worse. "It's very disappointing and I'll have to do my best to deal with it. Time will shortly tell if it (the Australian Open) is a possibility or not. "I was not counting on this being the end of the day for me. "Maybe in a few days I'll have a much better sense of what my hopes will be."
llama3.2:1b: Andre Agassi pulled out of the Kooyong Classic due to a hip injury, which he described as tightening up rather than just tearing, potentially protecting his body from further damage. He has an MRI scan scheduled to determine the extent of the problem and is waiting to see if it will prevent him from participating in the Australian Open.
llama3.2:3b: Andre Agassi pulled out of the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury that caused cramping, but is hopeful it's not a serious tear and can recover in time for the Australian Open.
gemma2:2b: Andre Agassi withdrew from the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury, causing doubt about his Australian Open participation. He will undergo an MRI scan to determine the extent of the damage. Despite not suffering a complete tear like last year's Wimbledon injury, he expressed concern and uncertainty regarding his ability to play at the Australian Open.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The article discusses the recent decision by Andre Agassi to withdraw from the Australian Open due to an injury he suffered during his Kooyong Classic match against Andy Roddick. The author suggests that this is not the same injury that led him to miss Wimbledon in 2016, as it does not only tear but also tighten up and may be of concern for Agassi's overall health condition. He expresses regret and acknowledges that he did not feel comfortable with what he was doing, especially given his previous experience with injuries.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Andre Agassi pulled out of the Kooyong Classic due to a hip injury, which he had previously experienced but did not believe would affect his performance at the Australian Open. He is scheduled for an MRI scan to determine the extent of the damage and could potentially miss the tournament.
qwen2.5:3b: Andre Agassi's participation at the 2013 Australian Open was uncertain after he withdrew from the Kooyong Classic due to a hip injury. He stopped playing during a first-set match against Andy Roddick, citing cramping and discomfort in his hip. Agassi had previously missed Wimbledon because of a similar injury. An MRI scan will determine the extent of his current condition. Agassi believes it might be an issue where his body is protecting itself rather than severe damage. His chances at participating in the Australian Open remain uncertain as he awaits further medical assessment.

smollm:1.7b: The summary above captures the key ideas and details from the original text, preserving the main points while omitting unnecessary information. The main idea is that Agassi's involvement in the Australian Open was put in doubt after he pulled out of the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury, and he decided to bring a premature end to the match. The summary also mentions his decision to pull out of the match due to a hip injury, which forced him to miss Wimbledon last year.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, let's tackle this query step by step. The user has provided a text about Andre Agassi pulling out of the Kooyong Classic and his implications on Melbourne's Australian Open tournament. They want me to summarize it concisely while preserving key ideas and details.

First, I need to understand the main points. The summary should include the context of Agassi's pull-out, the reason for it (hip injury at 5-6 down), and the immediate aftermath with his MRI scan. Also, he mentioned that the injury was different from last year's Wimbledon, which might explain why it felt worse now.

I need to keep the language simple and avoid explanations or formatting. The user specified that I should output only the summary as plain text without any additional text, so I have to ensure that all important details are included accurately.

Looking at the provided text, I'll extract the key events: Agassi pulling out, injury details, MRI scanning, previous injury status, his reaction about the tough feelings, and his hopes for Melbourne's tournament. These points should form a clear and concise summary without adding any extra information.
</think>

Andre Agassi pulled out of the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury at 5-6 down, leading him to a premature match end in the first set. His MRI scan will assess the extent of the damage. He has won four Australian Opens before, but his injury this time was different from last year's Wimbledon. Agassi feels hurt and disappointed, considering Melbourne's Australian Open tournament is on the line.
tinyllama:1.1b: Agassi, who is set to compete at the Australian Open in February, has been forced to pull out of the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury. Agassi revealed that his injury was not the same as his previous hip injury and was caused by a tearing up issue. Despite this setback, he remains hopeful for a chance to compete at the Grand Slam tournament in February due to his injury not being too severe. The Australian Open is scheduled for later in February, and Agassi's involvement in the event remains uncertain. He will undergo an MRIs scan to determine the extent of the injury, but it is unclear if he will be able to compete in the Grand Slam tournament.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Agassi announced his withdrawal from the Kooyong Classic due to a hip injury. The Australian Open, which he had previously declared as his top goal, is now in jeopardy due to this unfortunate situation. Andre Agassi has been experiencing cramping pain and needs an MRI scan to determine the extent of the damage.

He said his hip was tightening up and possibly protecting itself from further damage, and expressed disappointment at having to pull out of the tournament.

chatgpt-4o-latest: Andre Agassi's participation in the Australian Open is uncertain after he withdrew from the Kooyong Classic due to a hip injury. He stopped his match against Andy Roddick at 5-6 in the first set, citing cramping. Agassi, a four-time Australian Open champion, will undergo an MRI to assess the damage but stated the injury is different from the one that kept him out of Wimbledon. He hopes the issue is muscle tightening rather than a tear but admitted the situation is concerning. He remains uncertain about his Australian Open chances and expects more clarity in a few days.
stablelm2:1.6b: Agassi concerned about Melbourne after hip injury in Kooyong Classic; MRI to determine extent of issue, different from previous hip injury; waiting on progress for Australian Open participation.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Andre Agassi, a four-time Australian Open champion, withdrew from the Kooyong Classic due to a worsening hip injury. He was leading 5-6 in the first set against Andy Roddick when he decided to end his match prematurely. Agassi, 34, will undergo an MRI scan to assess the injury's extent. Unlike previous issues that required surgery and forced his absence from Wimbledon last year, this pain is more likely due to muscle tightening rather than tearing. Agassi expressed concern about the ongoing discomfort and uncertain future for the Australian Open. He will need time to evaluate his participation prospects after further medical evaluation.
reference: "I was not counting on this being the end of the day for me.Andre Agassi's involvement in the Australian Open was put in doubt after he pulled out of the Kooyong Classic with a hip injury."That wasn't comfortable out there at all, what I was feeling."My hip was cramping and I just could not continue," said the 34-year-old.He said the problem was not the same as the hip injury which forced him to miss Wimbledon last year.
